alert.note: Alert for Bennett; Butte; Custer Co Plains; Fall River; Haakon; Hermosa Foot Hills; Jackson; Northern Foot Hills; Northern Meade Co Plains; Oglala Lakota; Pennington Co Plains; Rapid City; Southern Foot Hills; Southern Meade Co Plains; Sturgis, Piedmont Foot Hills; Ziebach (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued April 02 at 2:03PM MDT until April 05 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS RapidCity
info.description: ...Blizzard conditions expected Monday afternoon into Wednesday for the Black Hills and western South Dakota... .A strong spring snowstorm will bring very heavy snow to the area, beginning across northeastern Wyoming and southwestern South Dakota Monday morning, spreading northeastward through the day. Winds will increase Monday with widespread 45-65 mph gusts across the area Tuesday afternoon, strongest winds across the western South Dakota plains. The combination of very heavy snow, strong winds, and blowing and drifting snow will result in very difficult travel conditions late Monday through Wednesday. ...BLIZZARD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM MONDAY TO 6 PM MDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions expected. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 2 feet, with locally higher amounts possible. Winds gusting as high as 65 mph. Strongest winds expected late Tuesday morning into Tuesday evening. * WHERE...Portions of northwestern and southwestern South Dakota and northeast Wyoming. This includes the Tribal Lands of the Cheyenne River Reservation and the Pine Ridge Reservation. * WHEN...From 6 PM Monday to 6 PM MDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Strong winds could cause tree damage.
info.instruction: A Blizzard Warning means the combination of snow, blowing snow, and strong winds will create dangerous whiteout conditions. Road conditions are available on your smartphone from the 5 1 1 app for your state.
